product_context.title: PRD Employee Tickets
product_context.why_built: Editing attendance records and processing employee requests currently requires managers to manually read messages, track requests, and enter corrections - an inefficient process prone to errors. Employees need a structured way to submit edit requests with all required information, and managers need a streamlined workflow to review and process them. A ticket-based system standardizes the request and approval process, eliminating manual tracking and processing inefficiencies. The system supports multiple ticket types (Attendance Regularization, Leave Encashment, and future custom types) to handle diverse employee requests.
key_design_decisions: Ticket types released in phases: Release 1 (Attendance Regularization), Release 2 (Leave Encashment), Release 3 (Custom Ticket Types)
Premade ticket types have view-only configuration for system fields; only name, description, employee mapping, and admin roles are editable
Default employee mapping includes all active employees; new employees must be manually added to ticket types as needed
Approval flow changes mid-process: pending/partially approved tickets migrate to new flow; approved tickets remain unaffected
Line Managers can view all reportees' tickets (direct and indirect) for streamlined approval
Ticket state transitions allow seamless movement between Pending, Approved, and Rejected states
Notifications sent for all CRUD operations to alert creators and approvers
Centralized ticket system: Consolidates all employee edit/update requests (attendance, leave encashment, profile updates, custom requests) in one interface
Premade ticket types: Attendance regularization (R1) and leave encashment (R2) provided as templates; custom tickets (R3) enable extensibility
Approval flow routing: Default routing to Line Manager 1; configurable for different approval chains
Search and filter: Approvers can search/filter by employee, ticket ID, ticket type for efficient processing
Notification system: Email and mobile push alerts for CRUD operations on tickets
State transitions: Tickets move between Pending, Approved, Rejected states with audit trail
Line Manager delegation: Managers can create tickets on behalf of employees when configured

product_context.title: PRD: Custom Employee Tickets
product_context.why_built: Organizations have unique internal processes that do not fit pre-defined ticket types like attendance or leave requests. HR needs to create custom request types with specific fields, approval workflows, and visibility rules. This module enables organizations to digitize any internal process through configurable ticket types rather than relying on email or paper forms. With custom tickets, HR can manage diverse requests (business trips, loans, resignation, office supplies, shift changes) within a single structured system.
key_design_decisions: Custom fields support 6 predefined data types: Text, Paragraph, Number, Date, Attachment, List
List fields can be created on-the-fly or fetched from a reusable List Library for consistency
Eligibility rules support filtering by Department, Office, Country, Gender with manual include/exclude overrides
Approval flow supports sequential or parallel logic with multiple approvers assigned by role
Ticket type configuration changes show warning if already in use; existing tickets retain previous field versions
Built-in ticket types cannot be deleted or have category changed; system lists cannot be deactivated
Arabic and English translations required for all labels and field names for bilingual support
At least one role must be assigned who can create each ticket type
Configurable ticket types: Admins define categories, fields (system or custom), eligibility rules, and approval flows
Field flexibility: Support for Text, Number, List, Date, Time fields with mandatory/optional designation
Localization support: Arabic and English translations for all labels and custom lists
Built-in ticket types: Attendance regularization and leave encashment provided as premade templates
Version tracking: Existing tickets retain previous field versions after ticket type edits

product_context.title: WIP - Opportunity Assessment - Air tickets automatic encashment
product_context.why_built: Air ticket encashment currently requires manual tracking of policy entitlements, creating administrative burden and errors. With over 250 companies requesting automation and 60% of air ticket requests being encashment requests, automating this process reduces HR workload significantly. Automatic encashment tracking and processing eliminates manual record-keeping and ensures employees receive their entitled benefits. This feature extends the ticket system to handle benefits automation.
key_design_decisions: Admin configures air ticket policy with encashment intervals (e.g., annually or at employee milestones)
System automatically generates encashment requests based on pre-defined intervals
Service period eligibility is enforced before encashment generation
System tracks encashment status and updates dashboards for HR and payroll
Renewal reminders sent automatically to stakeholders
Payroll processes encashment amounts seamlessly
Future employee self-service portal: Phase 2 will enable employees to view upcoming encashments and submit/modify requests
HR may need ability to adjust automated requests in exceptional cases (manual override)
Workflow-based automation: Admins configure encashment intervals (annual, milestone-based) at policy level
Automatic request generation: System monitors employee service periods and triggers encashment requests at configured intervals
Mandatory payout rule: Air ticket policy amount must be paid out when service period requirements are met
Integration with approval workflows: Automated requests route through configured approvers before payroll processing
Renewal reminders: Automatic notifications sent to HR/payroll stakeholders

product_context.title: PRD: Employee Records V2.1
product_context.why_built: Improve employee list management for companies with large workforces. Admins need to view up to 500 employees at once (instead of 10), use global search accessible via CMD/CTRL+K from anywhere in the product, see recently viewed employees and recent searches for quick access, and view additional employee data points (role, department) directly in the list.
key_design_decisions: Pagination enhancement: Support for 10/25/50/100/250/500 rows per page to accommodate large employee lists
Global search shortcut: CMD/CTRL+K accessible from anywhere in product for fast employee lookup
Recently viewed tracking: Display up to 5 recently viewed employees for quick re-access
Recent searches: Show up to 5 recent search terms with one-click pre-fill capability
Enhanced list view: Display name, role, and department columns directly in employee list
Search result handling: Show 'no results' message with guidance when search yields no matches
Country-conditional fields: UAE-specific fields (Residence Visa Location, Trade License, MOL No.) only shown when Legal Country of Residence is UAE

detected_integrations.description: Leave encashment tickets and salary adjustments flow to payroll for processing. Approved encashment requests are added to payroll as salary adjustments. Payroll system calculates and processes payments based on ticket approvals.
Email and in-app notifications sent for ticket CRUD operations. Renewal reminders sent automatically to HR/payroll stakeholders for air ticket encashments. Alerts approvers of pending tickets.

Employee profile data auto-populates ticket forms. Dynamic variables in letter templates pull from employee records. Employee eligibility for ticket types determined by profile attributes (department, office, country, gender).
Attendance regularization tickets reference attendance records. Extra hours compensation requests integrate with attendance tracking. Attendance data displayed in ticket details for approver review.
Leave encashment tickets reference leave balances. Leave calendar displays approved leave requests. Leave request editing integrates with ticket approval workflows.

Tickets routed through configured approval flows. Sequential or parallel approval logic supported. Line managers can approve reportees' tickets. Approval flow changes mid-process migrate pending tickets to new flow.
Reusable dropdown lists created in List Library and referenced by custom ticket fields. List values shared across multiple ticket types for consistency.
User roles determine who can create tickets, approve tickets, and access employee ticket admin settings. Line managers can view all reportees' tickets (direct and indirect).

Employee profile stores comprehensive personal, employment, compliance, and benefits information. Ticket eligibility rules filter by employee attributes (department, office, country, gender). Service period tracking in profile determines air ticket encashment eligibility.
Encashment requests are managed through Finance menu. Air ticket admin view accessible for configuration and monitoring.
Ticket reports can be generated and downloaded asynchronously. Encashment status and compliance tracked in HR dashboards.
Custom Employee Ticket types require manual integration with Leave and Attendance modules. Approval flows are not automatically configured when custom ticket types are created.
Performance cycle dates cannot be self-service modified after cycle initiation, requiring backend intervention.
Air ticket entitlements are not automatically integrated with EOS calculations, requiring manual handling for employee departures.
Air ticket requests lack state transition capabilities once booked, creating rigid workflow constraints.
Document approval workflows, dependent document editing, and document relationship maintenance are core to employee records and letter request processes.
Employee status management, offboarding process, and inactive employee restrictions are critical to onboarding/offboarding workflows.
Global search functionality and employee identifier handling depend on robust backend search mechanisms and employee record access controls.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Custom Role Configuration Requires Backend Intervention
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Custom roles created in the system are not automatically propagated to ticket approval workflow configurations. Administrators cannot self-service assign custom roles to approval flows; backend team intervention is required to enable custom roles in dropdowns and approval routing. This creates a manual bottleneck for role-based access control setup.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Inability to Delete or Reverse Processed Tickets
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Once tickets (air tickets, expense entries, encashment records) are processed or finalized, users cannot delete, reverse, or modify them. This prevents cleanup of test data, correction of erroneous entries, or reversal of booked transactions. Users must rely on backend database intervention or complex payroll reopening procedures to remove processed records.
what_to_watch_out_for.documented_workaround: For air tickets processed in payroll: reopen payroll period, delete transaction, move to pending status (complex manual process)

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Line Manager Ticket Submission & Notification Gaps
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Line managers cannot submit attendance or other tickets on behalf of their team members—only attendance admins can create tickets. Additionally, when line managers are outside the standard approval flow (e.g., proxy requesters), they receive no notifications about ticket processing. Role-based permission configuration also allows unintended roles (e.g., Line Managers) to modify ticket priorities when this should be restricted to admins.

Role-based group restrictions are not consistently enforced across HR modules. People Managers and Adjustment Managers can view and edit employees outside their assigned groups in HR and document modules (grouping functionality exists only in Finance and Payroll). Expense Manager role lacks granular permission controls to restrict cross-module data visibility or segment viewable financial information by category.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Air Ticket Carry-Over & Entitlement Integration Gaps
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform does not support indefinite carry-over of unused air ticket balances between policy years. Air ticket entitlements are not automatically integrated with EOS (End of Service) calculations, requiring manual handling when employees leave. Employees lack a unified interface to manage air ticket requests under various policy conditions and cannot fully interact with or understand their air ticket encashment status.

Users are unaware that custom approval flows exist for attendance regularization tickets (missing check-out), believing tickets can only route to HR by default. The platform lacks a straightforward UI mechanism for administrators to create custom roles directly and assign them to approval workflows; custom role creation is restricted to predefined system roles.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Pending Ticket Count Visibility in Reporting
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The reporting dashboard lacks the ability to dynamically display pending employee ticket counts, restricting visibility into workforce ticket status and tracking metrics.
what_to_watch_out_for.design_rationale: Strategic decision not to implement pending ticket count display in reporting

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Custom Employee Ticket types (e.g., 'Hourly Permission') are not automatically integrated with Leave or Attendance modules. Each custom ticket type requires manual configuration of approval flows, which is not intuitively clear to users. Additionally, Performance Management module lacks self-service functionality for users to modify cycle dates after initiation.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Leave Encashment Ticket Type Not Implemented
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform does not support a dedicated leave encashment ticket type within the employee tickets module. This is a strategic business decision limiting leave management functionality.
what_to_watch_out_for.design_rationale: Strategic decision not to implement leave encashment ticket type in employee tickets module

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform lacks a user-friendly bulk deletion mechanism for time and pay adjustments. Users must rely on backend database queries to perform comprehensive record deletions, requiring technical intervention.

The platform does not support flexible document approval workflows that allow post-approval modifications, attachment uploads, or status reversions for letter requests. Additionally, document relationships are not automatically maintained when documents are replaced or edited, requiring manual re-establishment of links.

The employee import process lacks comprehensive backend validation to prevent data integrity risks. Specifically: (1) type column modifications for existing employees and dependants are not restricted, allowing accidental reclassification; (2) soft-deleted employee records cannot be gracefully re-imported, causing 404 errors; (3) duplicate employee IDs can be created through copy-paste actions in Excel imports due to insufficient unique identifier validation.

The platform lacks flexible configuration mechanisms for employee records across multiple dimensions: (1) type configuration for employee tickets cannot be set at company-wide level; (2) leave encashment ticket types cannot be dynamically created after policy configuration; (3) contract type information cannot be captured or displayed in employee work profiles; (4) custom data point tracking and table configuration are not supported, preventing accommodation of user-specific tracking requirements.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Frontend Form State & UI Interaction Instability
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform exhibits multiple frontend form handling issues that impact data entry accuracy: (1) conditionally visible fields lose their data when becoming invisible, requiring page refresh to restore information; (2) option selection is inconsistent—clicking one option may unexpectedly select a different item; (3) document card layouts distort across different screen resolutions due to lack of responsive design mechanisms.

The platform has multiple access and search-related issues affecting employee record retrieval: (1) previously reported employees encounter 403 errors when accessing the Line Manager Screen, indicating incomplete permission validation; (2) search history causes frontend errors when employees are deleted, creating data inconsistency; (3) the backend search mechanism cannot effectively handle complex, long-format employee identifiers with multiple separators, limiting global search effectiveness.

The platform lacks nuanced document editing controls for dependent documents across different document types. There is no mechanism to dynamically restrict document modifications based on insurance policy stage or administrative preferences, resulting in inconsistent edit restrictions across document types.

The platform has two related employee status management issues: (1) the offboarding process exhibits inconsistent error handling where 404 errors can still occur despite previous fix attempts, indicating incomplete resolution; (2) the system allows mentioning inactive or off-boarded employees in comments and leave requests, creating potential confusion and inappropriate interaction scenarios.

The platform has multiple data export limitations: (1) date formatting in Excel exports is inconsistent across regional configurations, particularly in Turkish region settings, causing unexpected output formats; (2) Excel file generation and download fails in the View Team Page, preventing users from exporting and analyzing team data efficiently.

The platform lacks an automated workflow for employee change requests, particularly for department changes. HR administrators must manually update employee profiles through email-based processes, creating inefficiency and potential for manual errors.

The platform lacks a standardized admin dashboard for employee field updates, forcing manual database interventions that introduce data integrity risks and potential cache synchronization problems. Additionally, the platform prioritizes maintenance simplicity over granular UI text customization, limiting flexibility in permission-based text variations.
